text: Hey <@U06GS7BG27J>, Running the app with HubSpot integration on iOS, I’m getting this error: `Fatal error: 'try!' expression unexpectedly raised an error: HubSpotMobileSDK.HubSpotConfigError.missingConfiguration` Any idea what might be the issue?
Hi there - this usually indicates that the expected HubSpot-Info.plist file couldn't be found. I would first check that - that its included in your project, and checked as part of the app target.

Hi Jason. It is there and checked as part of the app target.
Currently, I just modified the one I found in the demo app. Also found something in the documentations on Github saying `Be sure to download and include the `HubSpot-Info.plist` file from your HubSpot account at [<http://HubSpot.com|HubSpot.com>](<https://www.HubSpot.com>)` Do you know where can I find it in HubSpot control panel?

Is the filename still "HubSpot-Info.plist" ? incase its being renamed when copying or modified from the demo?

I'm not 100% on where to get your current config from - hopefully someone else might  - <@U07ARLLF39N> or <@U06GS7BG27J> might be able to advise on that.
<@U079Q5TKP0U> Another question if you don't mind: when you get this crash, is it immediately on launch, or when attempting to open a chat / interact with a widget?
No it is on the app launch
Hi! If you're ungated for the beta, you should be able to find the config files for copy/download in your Inbox settings: Inboxes (select inbox for the SDK) > Chat (edit) > Mobile SDK.
I was able to download it. Seems fairly similar to what I had before, but let me test it anyway with this new config
Great, It started working fine on iOS. Thank you guys.
Should PNs work on the beta version if configured?
I believe they should. Please feel free to configure them and let us know if you aren't receiving them as expected.

I did configure them based on the demo project as there weren’t any docs for that. But I’m not getting any PNs right now on simulator. Should it be a real device?
Also we use FCM for our internal PNs. Is HubSpot PNs working fine alongside FCM?

I know we've seen success with Firebase previously while noting that we'd be leaning towards (or requiring?) usage of the <https://firebase.google.com/docs/cloud-messaging/migrate-v1|newer APIs>. Let me try to pull in the BE team handling push notifications, but in the meantime maybe <@U078R2CHSA0> can help with this when online.

<@U079Q5TKP0U> - I have the following back from the Live Chat BE team:
> I did configure them based on the demo project as there weren’t any docs for that. But I’m not getting any PNs right now on simulator. Should it be a real device?
We do not support sending notifications to sandbox environments at this time. You will need to use production credentials. This _should_ work on emulators too but ymmv.

> Also we use FCM for our internal PNs. Is HubSpot PNs working fine alongside FCM?
From what I understand, yes HubSpot push notifications should work fine alongside FCM. You just need to create a new set of credentials in APNs and Firebase for HubSpot. Also make sure you are using a different topic for notifications. HubSpot uses the topic that is the package name for your app.
